boardgame.name: Castello
Castello
Masons
Mauer Bauer
Mauerbauer
boardgame.description: In Masons, players represent architects, who together establish cities on the landscape of the game board. When a city is completed, all players score points for _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;guild cards_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; they play, with the right timing in playing the right card making all the difference._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each turn, a player first establishes a new wall somewhere on the board. Each wall will be enclosed by two towers, and will have one house placed on each side of it. It's possible for a wall to need only one, or zero, new towers by putting it next to existing towers. It's possible for only one house to be placed, if the wall is placed along the outside of the game board._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;After placing the wall, the player rolls three dice to determine the color of one of the towers (the color of a possible second tower may be freely chosen), and that of the two houses (if only one house is placed, then the player may choose which of the dice to pick for the color of the house)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Finally, if the newly placed wall causes a piece of land to be fully enclosed, a new city has been established. If the new city borders one or more existing cities, it may be combined with one of those cities. Two houses of the same color inside the city are upgraded to a palace. A scoring round is now triggered, during which all players get to play one or two _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;guild cards_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, and then draw one new card. Each guild card will score a feature of either the just completed city, or outside it. Possible features are the number of houses _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; palaces or towers of a specified color, the number of fields of the city, the number of houses inside a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;district_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; on the board, the number of palaces inside a city, the different number of colors inside a city, or the total number of completed cities. At the end of a scoring round, whichever player is in last place may discard as many guild cards as desired, and draw new ones to replace them._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game ends when all pieces of a certain type have been played, and the winner is whoever has the most points._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups

listing.notes: I´m offering MAUERBAUER by HANS IM GLÜCK Shipping is EUR 9.00 within Europe or EUR 13.00 worldwide. The delivery time varies from 1 to 5 weeks. I can offer even more games upon request. Please also check listings of my friend montsegur - combined regular shipping is possible. For more details on my USA special shipping offer please click robbirob and then the more info button.

Brand New!! Still in shrinkwrap. Will ship internationally. Rio Grande Games (RIO 292)

never played +++++ german version, but game components are completely language independent and you can download rules translations from boardgamegeek +++++ will be shipped insured +++++ payment for germany : personal pick up in berlin or bank transfer +++++ payment for usa, canada, asia and australia : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have no euro : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have euro : direct bank transfer (wich is cost-free !) or cash (by letter) +++++ for all : no checks ! +++++ international buyers beware : though german postal is relatively fast, they sadly are not cheap (about 19 - 45 euros, it depends on where the package has to be shipped and the weight), so please ask for prices, before you hit the buy button ! +++++ shipment inside germany costs 8 euros

Hans im Glück German edition; There_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a production error with the game box. On one of the smaller sides, the cover paper has not been folded around into the box top. All it means is the box looks a little funny from one side, though.
New in Shrink

The box is a little dinged up (it was bought new on a clearance shelf and had obviously been picked up and put down several times), but no tears, holes, or split corners. Components are in perfect condition, and it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s only been played once.

Minor shelf wear, slight crunch in box bottom, never played, insert has been removed and instead there is a nice Plano case which you can keep for an extra $6 (yeah, they can be expensive). When ordering, please be sure to let me know if you want the storage container included and add the additional cost to the total. If you don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t ask for the container I will move the components into baggies before shipping. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m an avid game collector in a smoke-free home and take good care of my games. Unless otherwise noted above, game is complete with little or no shelf wear or damaged components. High-resolution picture available upon request. Domestic US shipping is $11.35 for USPS Priority Mail with tracking (insurance is optional if you want to pay for it). International shipping will be actual price plus USD$5.00 (sorry, it is a much bigger hassle on my end, plus I need to provide the box). Contact me if you have any questions about shipping. Must pay me via PayPal (I will cover the fees). I have many other games up for sale and in most cases I can combine shipping for some significant savings, but please check with me and provide your zip code for details.
